Class CurrentSessionData

  • java.lang.Object
    • CurrentSessionData

  • public class CurrentSessionData
extends java.lang.Object
    CurrentSession.java
    Since:
    28/11/2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alex Jones No copyright infringements intended, holds no copyright. This class is for many things: - Save the data of the current login so that it can persist between files. - Write to any files - Check if files contain certain names - Anything to do with reading or writing to data files is done here.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CurrentSessionData()
      Initialises the current session and runs getUsername().
      CurrentSessionData(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String type)
      Upon login, this method writes to file the username and type.

    • Method Detail

      • setFine

        public void setFine(int daysLate,
                    java.lang.String type,
                    java.lang.String user)
        Sets a fine based on the resource and amount of days that the user has kept the resource for past it's due date, with a maximum fine set for each resource type (Book and DVD = 25, Laptop = 100).
        Parameters:
        daysLate - The amount of days past the due date.
        type - The resource type.
        user - The username of the fined user.

        Parameters:

      • getFile

        public java.util.Scanner getFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns a file, the whole thing.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file (only needs to be the filename, don't include PATH, or ".txt")
        Returns:

      • getFileLine

        public java.lang.String getFileLine(java.lang.String filename,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a line from a file if the parameter 'name' is contained. It then removes username as when called this will be on specific user dashboards, therefore username isn't required.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file (exclude path and ".txt")
        name - The name being searched for in the file.
        Returns:
        The whole line (if 'name' is present) as a string.

      • isInFile

        public java.lang.Boolean isInFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                  java.lang.String nameContained)
        Checks if a name is in a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename (excluding path and ".txt")
        nameContained - The name being searched for
        Returns:
        True if the name is present, false otherwise.

        Writes the user's fine to pay request to the file that the librarian views.
        Parameters:
        username - The username.
        fineToPay - The amount they're attempting to pay.

      • libAcceptUserFinePayment

        public void libAcceptUserFinePayment(java.lang.String date,
                                     java.lang.String time)
        This method is to accept all user fines as a librarian, then updates other data files using a private method.
        Parameters:
        date - The current date.
        time - The time, to be set.

                          java.lang.String newLine)
        This method is to override a specific line in any given file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file
        uniqueStringInLine - A unique identifier in the file that can identify the line.
        newLine - The new line to be written.

      • getWholeFileLine

        public java.lang.String getWholeFileLine(java.lang.String filename,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the whole line from a file if the parameter 'name' is contained.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file (exclude path and ".txt")
        name - The name being searched for in the file.
        Returns:
        The whole line (if 'name' is present) as a string.

      • addToLine

        public void addToLine(java.lang.String identifierInLine,
                      java.lang.String dataToAdd,
                      java.lang.String delimiterInFile,
                      java.lang.String filename)
        This method is to append data to the end of the line in a given file. This will be used for reserved resources, resource queue, requested resources etc.
        Parameters:
        identifierInLine - Something that uniquely identifies the line to be edited (i.e. something that doesn't occur anywhere else e.g. a username/name of the resource queue)
        dataToAdd - Data to be added to the file
        delimiterInFile - The delimiter used in whichever text file
        filename - The name of the ".txt" file

      • countNumResources

        public int countNumResources(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
        Counts the number of resources based on perfect input and assuming the resource can be found.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifier - A unique identifier that persists between multiple copies (i.e. title)
        Returns:
        The number in the database

      • editLine

        public void editLine(java.lang.String filename,
                     java.lang.String identifierInLine,
                     java.lang.String partToChange,
                     java.lang.String updatedString)
        Edits a given line in a text file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to edit.
        identifierInLine - The unique identifier of a line.
        partToChange - The part to be changed in the line.
        updatedString - The part that needs to be replaced in the line.

      • showNumResources

        public java.lang.String showNumResources(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
        This returns a block of the same resources (i.e. to show all of the resources, this is mainly used for viewing availability)
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifier - The identifier that is shared between multiple resources but separates them from others.
        Returns:
        A block of text with all resources.

      • showBRDD

        public java.lang.String showBRDD(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
        This returns a block of the same BRDD (i.e. to show all of the resources, this is mainly used for viewing availability)
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifier - The identifier that is shared between multiple resources but separates them from others.
        Returns:
        A block of text with all resources.

        Returns:

      • countDaysOverdue

                            java.lang.String date)
        Counts the amount of days a resource has been overdue for.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user borrowing the copy for over the due date.
        date - The current date.
        Returns:
        The amount of days overdue.

      • removeLineFromFileBRDD

        Parameters:

      • hasReservedQueue

        public boolean hasReservedQueue(java.lang.String title)
        Checks if there are users in the reserved queue.
        Parameters:
        title - Title at the head of the queue.
        Returns:
        True if usernames follow the title, else false.

      • hasResourceQueue

        public boolean hasResourceQueue(java.lang.String title)
        Checks if there are users in the resource queue.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if usernames follow the title, else false.
